Summary Heading: You know, this might just be the besthotel for a Disneland fanatic
Summary: We've had 40 trips to DL over the years, and this place kind of hit all the boxes. It's not luxurious, but its clean, small and functional. About a 12 minute walk to Harbor side security. It costs almost nothing, like the ones right across from the Harbor gate used to (I'm looking at you, Park Vue). There's a Starbucks 50 yards away and a Walgreens 100. The pool's little, but good enough for the rug rats to take a mid day break. There's no breakfast, but a DL fanatic wants to make rope drop, not eat Sysco scrambled eggs. The desk clerk is there 24-7. Because the hotel only has about 25 rooms, the wifi router is wicked fast. Look, if you've got 400 a night to spend go stay at the DL hotel. If you're fanatics like us, who make rope drop and stay to closing, it's perfect. Only

Soft beds, great AC, nice big bathroom and fridge-all together a good stay.

The room featured hardwood floors, comfortable beds, air conditioning, tv, fridge, and microwave. Breakfast consisted of coffee, mini boxes of cereal and bread for toast. Easy for a grab and go kind-of-day. It took 12-15mins to walk from the motel to the security lines at Disneyland. It was an easy walk down Harbor and a left at Disney Way.   My only complaint was that the front desk lady was a little less than thrilled to hold our luggage for a few hours the day we checked out since our flight didn't leave until later in the evening and we didn't have a rental car to store them. Summary: This was my first trip to Disneyland and I actually work for a travel agency and have a high standard for hotel rooms and although this is listed as a 2star hotel it was very nice! The beds were large and comfortable, the bathroom was huge, there was a huge flat screen tv with Direct TV service, microwave with fridge/freezer and a pool. The shuttle to Disney is only 20 steps away! The manager was so nice and friendly and the room was cleaned and restocked everyday! I loved staying here and I will do so in the future! I really recommend this hotel. It's worth more than the money spent!

Summary Heading: Great location, great deal on a simple place to stay!
Summary: We stayed at another hotel for 3 nights at a conference for work, that was seriously overpriced!  Whe the conference ended, we stayed at the Riviera for 2 more nights.  Such a great value-we paid $67 per night.  Its very simple but clean.  The couple who work there were great-very friendly and helpful.  They even let us park our car their after we'd checked out while we went to Disneyland!  Great location also, just 2 blocks away from Disneyland and right in front of the Garden Walk, full of restaurants and shops.  We would defininitely stay here again if we return to Anaheim.

Summary: We were a little worried about checking in here after reading some previous reviews.  However I can honestly say after an 8 night stay we were very happy here.
